message: The latest refereed articles appearing in The R Journal can be found here: http://journal.r-project.org/current.html
Principal Components Analysis: A How-To Manual for R, https://parmesan.mc.vanderbilt.edu/turnersd/ggd/2010-11-18-PCA-tutorial.pdf
Statistical aspects of data mining :: video lectures, This is the Google campus version of Stats 202 which was taught at Stanford in 2007. http://ff.im/zwHqT
Rob Hyndman's recommendations for books on ECONOMETRICS using R: http://robjhyndman.com/researchtips/econometrics-and-r/  -- Q: how's Pfaff's book on time series analysis?
Dirk Eddelbuettel's review of "R in a Nutshell" -- http://www.jstatsoft.org/v40/b01/paper

Paul Teetor's 2011 book, R Cookbook, has some useful tips. For example, there are some very peculiar features covered in Data Structures which help explain why some operations return strange looking results, and how some elegant operations work under the hood (with hidden assumptions).
The R Inferno revised (2011 edition) as  PDF: http://www.burns-stat.com/pages/Tutor/R_inferno.pdf -- the previous one was dated 2009.
just started new rstats groups at MENDELEY http://www.mendeley.com/groups/1215411/rstats/ where the focus is academic references (with scientific applications) -- you are invited to join.

Kalman Filtering in R,  Fernando Tusell (2011)
Journal of Statistical Software 39(2):1-27
http://www.jstatsoft.org/v39/i02/paper
State Space Models in R \\ Giovanni Petris, Sonia Petrone (2011) Journal of Statistical Software 41 (4) http://www.jstatsoft.org/v41/i04
